intro: Oxypetalum erectum subsp. erectum, commonly known as the upright oxypetalum, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly encountered in the wild.
